item.title: Fortnite Adds New TMNT Skins Featuring Casey Jones And Iconic Villains
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/fortnite-adds-new-tmnt-skins-featuring-casey-jones-and-iconic-villains/1100-6531017/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Another wave of TMNT content arrives ahead of Fortnite's big Chapter 6 Season 3 update. Casey Jones, as well as skins for three iconic villains of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, will hit the in-game shop later today.

Epic Games announced that all of this TMNT content will hit Fortnite when its shop update goes live on April 22 at 8 PM ET / 5 PM PT. This shop refresh brings TMNT's Casey Jones, Krang, Rocksteady, and Bebop, as well as their respective Lego Styles and TMNT instruments.

The iconic Turtle Van, also known as the Party Wagon, will arrive in both Fortnite and Rocket League shops.

TMNT's first crossover event added the turtles, April O'Neil, Splinter, and Shredder. This new TMNT event, however, expands the series' influence on Fortnite and is part of UEFN, enabling players to create their own Ninja Turtle-themed islands. Epic Games announced the latest update makes all TMNT skins fully compatible with the game's character, NPC spawner, and guard devices, meaning players can create custom behaviors, animations, and even full-blown cinematics with the turtles.

Additionally, today's update adds the new Dimension X Starter Island template, which showcases the Technodrome Prefab and features new landscape materials, VFX, and a space-inspired skybox. Epic says this island is a blank canvas with no built-in gameplay, so players have complete control over their TMNT island creations.

In other Fortnite news, a Star Wars event has been revealed for Chapter 6 Season 3, which kicks off on May 2. Make sure to check out all the rumors and announcements revealed for Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 3, including battle pass details and new Star Wars skins.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Destiny 2 The Edge Of Fate Trailer Hints At What's Next For Bungie's Space Shooter
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/destiny-2-the-edge-of-fate-trailer-hints-at-whats-next-for-bungies-space-shooter/1100-6531015/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Though Bungie has already announced a showcase for Destiny 2: The Edge of Fate which takes place on May 6, a new teaser trailer adds additional context and hints towards the future of the sci-fi shooter.

The Edge of Fate is the name of Destiny 2's next big content drop. Though it hasn't been confirmed, we can assume this is either the next expansion, or the summer 2025 major update. While we faced off against The Witness in The Final Shape, and dealt with the aftermath in the episodic content that followed, the Edge of Fate represents a new beginning for Guardians.

The teaser trailer shows a Guardian and their ship flying toward symbols from the Nine. The Nine, sometimes stylized as the IX, are a group associated with the Sol System--the system where all of Destiny's activities so far have taken place.

They also control Unknown Space, which so far we know nothing much about. However, in the top left corner of the teaser trailer, the word 'Kepler' appears to be seen, although it's missing the 'r' thanks to the framing of the video. In real-world terms, Kepler are planets outside of our solar system that were discovered by NASA's Kepler space telescope. (Thanks Reckerless on YouTube).

The 15 seen alongside it could refer to the 15th Kepler planet, also known as Kepler-15 b. The trailer also seems to show the word 'Chiago' upside down, but it's not immediately obvious what this could refer to. All of these hints certainly seem to suggest that Guardians might finally be preparing to enter a brand-new system.

It's not the only reference to the enigmatic space entities that Bungie has dropped recently, as there's a limited-time Rite of the Nine event taking place in-game until the launch of the next expansion.

Cheri Faulkner on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds Blossomdance Event Adds New Armor Sets, More Customization
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/monster-hunter-wilds-blossomdance-event-adds-new-armor-sets-more-customization/1100-6531014/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Monster Hunter Wilds' seasonal Festival of Accord: Blossomdance event is live, covering the Grand Hub in cherry blossoms and adding new armor sets and cosmetics to earn.

While the festival is live from April 22-May 6, Capcom states that "most" of the game's previously released event quests will return, in addition to two new ones.

Monster Hunter Wilds – Festival of Accord: Blossomdance | Spring Seasonal Event Trailer

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

The new Daughters of Carabosse quest tasks players with hunting two Lala Barinas and will reward materials to craft the new Blossom armor as well as butterfly-themed Palico equipment. Another quest, That Won't Work On Me, asks players to hunt a Tempered Xu Wu. Materials earned from the quest can be used to craft two new types of glasses and an eyepatch. Once created, the glasses can then be equipped by Alma for a new look (if players have previously completed the quest that unlocks glasses customization). Alma will additionally wear a special kimono during the event, after which players can unlock the outfit for her permanently via a separate purchase or by buying the Blossomdance DLC pack, which includes additional cosmetics and gestures.

Log-in rewards over the course of the event will earn special tickets that can be used to craft the free Sakuratide armor set and Papier-mache Palico armor. Having the Sakuratide armor equipped while doing certain quests during the event will actually grant more reward tickets, and regular login bonuses during the event will be increased.

Those who login during the event will also score a special festival-themed Seikret decorations, pop-up camp decorations, and gestures, along with unique nameplates, backgrounds, poses, and titles that can be used on the Hunter Profile.

All of those cosmetics are in addition to the visual overhaul of the recently added Grand Hub added as part of the game's first title update. During the event, special meals will also be available at the Grand Hub using vouchers earned from daily login rewards.

The Blossomdance event comes a few weeks after Monster Hunter Wilds first major update. Title Update 1 added a new monster, Mizutsune, alongside the High-Rank version of the game's story boss Zoa Shia.

In other news, Capcom announced its cracking down on Monster Hunter Wilds cheaters, warning players against joining quests with modified rewards. Doing so could corrupt save files or see players joining such quests punished by Capcom's anti-cheat measures. Capcom said future updates will include more robust anti-cheat features to detect people modifying the game's rewards for their own gain.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
